lines.text: The cleanest street in this town ain't half as good as the dirtiest alley in Philadelphia.
When I was a young doctor the gals used to go for me in a big way.
Sure but during the Civil War, most of the attractive men were at the front so the girls didn't have much choice.
Well, what's the big secret, Helen? You don't mean to tell me you're all well and want to go home?
No, but I eat all my carrots and it didn't make my hair a bit curly. Dr. Gillespie, I'm afraid you're an awful liar.
